cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Blood Reckoning
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller loses 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"There is no greater folly than standing against me."
—Nicol Bolas

rulings.text: Blood Reckoning will trigger once for each creature that attacks you or a planeswalker you control.
Creatures that are put onto the battlefield attacking were never declared as attackers and won't cause Blood Reckoning to trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller loses 1 life.

cards.name: Bloodhunter Bat
cards.text:
Flying
When Bloodhunter Bat enters the battlefield, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: It returns eager to share the feast of blood and gore with its ghoulish master.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Bloodhunter Bat enters the battlefield, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Bloodthrone Vampire
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Bloodthrone Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "What I need is your blood. What I don't need is your permission."

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Bloodthrone Vampire to activate its own ability, but it won't be on the battlefield to get the bonus.

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but the creature you wish to sacrifice is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Bloodthrone Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cower in Fear
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"You will fully understand fear when you discover it is the final thing you put your faith in."
—Nicol Bolas

rulings.text: Cower in Fear affects only creatures your opponents control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under their control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Crippling Blight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and can't block.
cards.flavor:
"Still alive? No matter. I'll leave you as a warning to others who would oppose me."
—Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and can't block.

cards.name: Dark Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Dark Favor enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.
cards.flavor: When he began to curse what he held holy, his strength grew unrivaled.

rulings.text: If the creature targeted by Dark Favor is an illegal target when Dark Favor tries to resolve, Dark Favor won't resolve. It won't enter the battlefield and its enters-the-battlefield ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Dark Favor enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.

cards.name: Diabolic Revelation
cards.text: Search your library for up to X cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"There are some secrets so dark no human mind should ever contain them. Interested?"
—Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to X cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Disciple of Bolas
cards.text: When Disciple of Bolas enters the battlefield, sacrifice another creature. You gain X life and draw X cards, where X is that creature's power.
cards.flavor: "Lord Bolas has shown me how each miserable little life holds untold resources."

rulings.text: You can't sacrifice Disciple of Bolas to its own ability, because it says "another."
You can't sacrifice more than one creature this way.

The ability is mandatory. If you control at least one other creature when the ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. If you don't control any other creatures at that time, the ability won't do anything.
The creature's power when it was last on the battlefield is the amount of life you gain and the number of cards you draw.

cards.originalText: When Disciple of Bolas enters the battlefield, sacrifice another creature. You gain X life and draw X cards, where X is that creature's power.

cards.name: Disentomb
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"I deal so often in rotting corpses that when I come across the freshly dead . . . why, it's like my birthday come early."
—Nevinyrral, necromancer

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Duskmantle Prowler
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

foreignNames.name: ダスクマントルをうろつくもの

cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Duty-Bound Dead
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{3}{B}: Regenerate Duty-Bound Dead. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{3}{B}: Regenerate Duty-Bound Dead. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Essence Drain
cards.text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Life's essence is a nectar unlike any I tasted when I lived as a mortal."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.originalText: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Giant Scorpion
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.
cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Harbor Bandit
cards.text:
Harbor Bandit gets +1/+1 as long as you control an Island.
{1}{U}: Harbor Bandit can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: He always drops a little trinket into the bay as thanks to the merfolk who taught him all his best tricks.

rulings.text: Activating Harbor Bandit's ability after it's been blocked won't cause it to become unblocked.

cards.originalText:
Harbor Bandit gets +1/+1 as long as you control an Island.
{1}{U}: Harbor Bandit is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Knight of Infamy
cards.text:
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "Your laws, like your bones, were made to be broken."
cards.originalText:
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Liliana of the Dark Realms
cards.text:
+1: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
−3: Target creature gets +X/+X or -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
−6: You get an emblem with "Swamps you control have '{T}: Add {B}{B}{B}{B}.'"

rulings.text: You can activate Liliana's first ability even if your library contains no Swamp cards (or you don't want to find one). You'll still search your library and shuffle it.

When you activate Liliana's second ability, you choose only the target creature. You choose whether that creature gets +X/+X or -X/-X when the ability resolves. The value of X is determined by the number of Swamps you control when the ability resolves.
Liliana's emblem doesn't remove any other abilities of Swamps you control.
Each of Liliana's abilities refers to lands (or land cards) with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
+1: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
-3: Target creature gets +X/+X or -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
-6: You get an emblem with "Swamps you control have ‘{T}: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.'"

cards.name: Liliana's Shade
cards.text:
When Liliana's Shade enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
{B}: Liliana's Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
When Liliana's Shade enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
{B}: Liliana's Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mark of the Vampire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink.
cards.flavor:
"My 'condition' is a trial. The weak are consumed by it. The strong transcend it."
—Sorin Markov

rulings.text: Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"What a pity. You should have written it down."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Murder
cards.text: Destroy target creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Mutilate
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.
cards.flavor:
"It's only torture if you're strong enough to survive. Otherwise, it's a simple, gruesome death. I'm happy with either outcome."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: The effect is based on the number of Swamps you control when Mutilate resolves. Only creatures on the battlefield at that time will be affected. The effect won't change later in the turn, even if the number of Swamps you control changes.

cards.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.

cards.name: Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis attacks alone, defending player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: Nefarox's last ability will trigger and resolve before blockers are declared.

foreignNames.name: グリクシスの首領、ネファロックス

cards.originalText:
Flying
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis attacks alone, defending player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Phylactery Lich
cards.text:
Indestructible
As Phylactery Lich enters the battlefield, put a phylactery counter on an artifact you control.
When you control no permanents with phylactery counters on them, sacrifice Phylactery Lich.

rulings.text: Phylactery Lich's first ability doesn't target the artifact. No player may take actions between the time you choose an artifact and the time you put a phylactery counter on it.

If you control no artifacts as Phylactery Lich enters the battlefield, its first ability won't do anything. As soon as it enters the battlefield, its last ability will trigger (unless you control some other permanent with a phylactery counter on it) and you'll have to sacrifice it.

If Phylactery Lich and an artifact are entering the battlefield under your control at the same time, you can't put a phylactery counter on that artifact. You must choose an artifact you control that's already on the battlefield.

Phylactery Lich's last ability is a "state trigger." Once a state trigger triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again.

Phylactery Lich's last ability checks your permanents for any phylactery counters, not just the specific one that it caused you to put on an artifact. For example, if you control two Phylactery Liches and two different artifacts with phylactery counters, neither Phylactery Lich will be sacrificed if one of those artifacts leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
As Phylactery Lich enters the battlefield, put a phylactery counter on an artifact you control.
Phylactery Lich is indestructible.
When you control no permanents with phylactery counters on them, sacrifice Phylactery Lich.

cards.name: Public Execution
cards.text: Destroy target creature an opponent controls. Each other creature that player controls gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.

rulings.text: Only creatures controlled by the player when Public Execution resolves will get -2/-0. Creatures that enter the battlefield under that player's control or that the player gains control of later in the turn are unaffected.

Public Execution targets only the creature it destroys. If that creature is an illegal target when Public Execution tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No creature will get -2/-0.
If the target creature regenerates or has indestructible, each other creature controlled by that creature's controller will still get -2/-0.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature an opponent controls. Each other creature that player controls gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Devouring books is only the beginning. The librarian's next.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavor:
"For my enemies, one death. For my allies, many."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn't overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can't be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature's colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave's effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature's types or subtypes.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Servant of Nefarox
cards.text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "My cause is power, and at the altar of power I will gladly forfeit my soul."

foreignNames.name: ネファロックスの召使い

cards.originalText: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Shimian Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Shimian Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: The cards you're searching for must be found and exiled if they're in the graveyard because it's a public zone. Finding those cards in the hand and library is optional, because those zones are hidden (even if the hand is temporarily revealed).
If the player has no nonland cards in their hand, you can still search that player's library and have them shuffle it.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Shimian Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Little agonies pave the way to greater power.
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.name: Tormented Soul
cards.text: Tormented Soul can't block and can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.
cards.originalText: Tormented Soul can't block and is unblockable.

cards.name: Vampire Nighthawk
cards.text: Flying, deathtouch, lifelink
cards.originalText:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Vampire Nocturnus
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.
cards.flavor: "Your life will set with the sun."

rulings.text: To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.
The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.
If the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus will give itself +2/+1 and flying even if it's somehow not a Vampire.

cards.originalText:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.

cards.name: Veilborn Ghoul
cards.text:
Veilborn Ghoul can't block.
Whenever a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Veilborn Ghoul from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Liliana's voice carries far, reaching beyond the cold pall of death.

rulings.text: Veilborn Ghoul's ability triggers only if it's in your graveyard at the moment the Swamp enters the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: ヴェール生まれのグール

cards.originalText:
Veilborn Ghoul can't block.
Whenever a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Veilborn Ghoul from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Vile Rebirth
cards.text: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor:
"'Here lies our beloved Gartu, the gentlest of all men.' Ooh, I love irony."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

rulings.text: If the creature card is an illegal target when Vile Rebirth tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't put a Zombie token onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Walking Corpse
cards.flavor:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

cards.name: Wit's End
cards.text: Target player discards their hand.
cards.flavor:
"Your pathetic ideas lie in shambles, Planeswalker. Where is your arrogant pride now?"
—Nicol Bolas
cards.originalText: Target player discards his or her hand.

cards.name: Xathrid Gorgon
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Put a petrification counter on target creature. It gains defender and becomes a colorless artifact in addition to its other types. Its activated abilities can't be activated. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

rulings.text: The effects of Xathrid Gorgon's ability don't depend on the petrification counter. If that counter is removed, the creature remains a colorless artifact with defender, and so on.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

foreignNames.name: ザスリッドのゴルゴン

cards.originalText:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Put a petrification counter on target creature. It gains defender and becomes a colorless artifact in addition to its other types. Its activated abilities can't be activated. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

cards.name: Zombie Goliath
cards.flavor:
"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

cards.name: Arms Dealer
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Guaranteed to leave your enemies sufficiently stabbed, bitten, cleaved, or exploded."
—Grezkrick's Emporium motto

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Arms Dealer to activate its own ability.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Bladetusk Boar
cards.text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
cards.flavor: Those who dare stand in its path are either brave or mindless. Or in the case of goblins, both.

rulings.text: Intimidate looks at the current colors of a creature that has it. Normally, Bladetusk Boar can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures. If it's turned blue, then it can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or blue creatures.
If an attacking creature has intimidate, what colors it is matters only as the defending player declares blockers. Once it's blocked, changing its colors won't change that.

cards.originalText: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.name: Canyon Minotaur
cards.flavor:
"We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No."

cards.name: Chandra, the Firebrand
cards.text:
+1: Chandra, the Firebrand deals 1 damage to any target.
−2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
−6: Chandra, the Firebrand deals 6 damage to each of up to six targets.

rulings.text: Chandra's second ability creates a delayed triggered ability that will copy the next instant or sorcery spell you cast that turn, regardless of whether that spell has targets.

When the delayed trigger resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. You control the copy. That copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell Chandra copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell Chandra copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Consume Spirit does), the copy has the same value of X.

You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if you sacrifice a 3/3 creature to cast Fling after activating Chandra's second ability, the copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage.

When you activate Chandra's last ability, you choose up to six target creatures and/or players. No damage is divided, and Chandra can't deal more than 6 damage to any one target. Chandra deals 6 damage to each target that is still legal when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
+1: Chandra, the Firebrand deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
-2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
-6: Chandra, the Firebrand deals 6 damage to each of up to six target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Chandra's Fury
cards.text: Chandra's Fury deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker and 1 damage to each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
cards.flavor: "I asked if they wanted to do things the easy way. I meant easy for me."

rulings.text: Chandra's Fury targets only the player, not any creature. Chandra's Fury will deal 1 damage to a creature with hexproof, for example.

cards.originalText: Chandra's Fury deals 4 damage to target player and 1 damage to each creature that player controls.

cards.name: Cleaver Riot
cards.text: Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn. (They deal both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor: Measure once, cut twice.

rulings.text: Cleaver Riot affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn. (They deal both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Craterize
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"'Utterly' is my favorite way to destroy something."
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Crimson Muckwader
cards.text:
Crimson Muckwader gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{2}{B}: Regenerate Crimson Muckwader. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText:
Crimson Muckwader gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{2}{B}: Regenerate Crimson Muckwader. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Dragon Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Those dragons grow fast. For a while they feed on squirrels and goblins and then suddenly you're missing a mammoth."
—Hurdek, Mazar mammoth trainer
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fervor
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"We won't sit like lazy gob-slugs waiting for death to come to us. We'll bring death, shiny sharp, to our enemies."
—Krenko, mob boss

rulings.text: If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won't be removed from combat.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor:
"Fire set free is a fearsome force—destructive, merciless, always hungry. Given direction, it is much worse."
—Jeflin, Vastwood shaman

cards.name: Firewing Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}{R}{R}: Return Firewing Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"When a phoenix nests in a volcano, we rejoice, for it means a hundred years of war."
—Golmak, Keldon warlord

rulings.text: Firewing Phoenix's ability can be activated only if Firewing Phoenix is in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}{R}{R}: Return Firewing Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Flames of the Firebrand
cards.text: Flames of the Firebrand deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
cards.flavor:
"You're in luck. I brought enough to share."
—Chandra Nalaar

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you cast Flames of the Firebrand, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. (In other words, as you put the spell on the stack, you choose whether to have it deal 3 damage to a single target, 2 damage to one target and 1 damage to another target, or 1 damage to each of three targets.)

cards.originalText: Flames of the Firebrand deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Furnace Whelp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Arsonist
cards.text: When Goblin Arsonist dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Arsonist dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin Battle Jester
cards.text: Whenever you cast a red spell, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Somehow goblins found a tactical advantage by sending a clown to war.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a red spell, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Hamletback Goliath
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Hamletback Goliath, where X is that creature's power.
cards.flavor:
"If you live on a giant's back, there's only one individual you'll ever need to fear."
—Gaddock Teeg

rulings.text: The value of X is determined as the ability begins resolving. If the other creature is no longer on the battlefield, its last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Hamletback Goliath, where X is that creature's power.

cards.name: Kindled Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane

rulings.text: Giving a creature first strike after creatures with first strike deal combat damage doesn't prevent that creature from dealing combat damage.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Krenko, Mob Boss
cards.text: {T}: Create X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens, where X is the number of Goblins you control.
cards.flavor:
"He displays a perverse charisma fueled by avarice. Highly dangerous. Recommend civil sanctions."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

rulings.text: The ability counts each Goblin you control, including Krenko itself, not just the tokens it creates.

cards.originalText: {T}: Put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the number of Goblins you control.

cards.name: Krenko's Command
cards.text: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Goblins are eager to follow orders, especially when those orders involve stealing, hurting, annoying, eating, destroying, or swearing.
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Magmaquake
cards.text: Magmaquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"Where will you run when I punish you with the very ground you flee on?"
—Nicol Bolas

rulings.text: Magmaquake doesn't target any creature or planeswalker. For example, it will deal damage to a creature without flying that has hexproof.

cards.originalText: Magmaquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each planeswalker.

cards.name: Mark of Mutiny
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it and untap it. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.

rulings.text: Mark of Mutiny can target any creature, even one that you already control or that is already untapped.
The +1/+1 counter remains on the creature after the control-changing effect ends.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it and untap it. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Mindclaw Shaman
cards.text: When Mindclaw Shaman enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You may cast an instant or sorcery card from it without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: Nicol Bolas gives power to those who will abuse it most.

rulings.text: Any player can respond to Mindclaw Shaman's triggered ability. However, once that ability starts resolving and the target opponent reveals their hand, players can't respond until after the ability finishes resolving. For example, the opponent can't cast the instant or sorcery card you choose to cast in order to stop you from casting it.

You cast the card from the opponent's hand immediately. Ignore timing restrictions based on the card's type. Other timing restrictions, such as "Cast [this card] only during combat," must be followed.
The card goes to its owner's graveyard after it resolves (or otherwise leaves the stack), not yours.

If you can't cast any instant or sorcery card (perhaps because there are no legal targets available) or if you choose not to cast one, then Mindclaw Shaman's ability finishes resolving and the game moves on.

If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs such as kicker costs. If the card has mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.
If the card has X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

cards.originalText: When Mindclaw Shaman enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may cast an instant or sorcery card from it without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Mogg Flunkies
cards.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

rulings.text: If you control more than one Mogg Flunkies, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, other attacking creatures don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don't have to block the same creature that Mogg Flunkies blocks.
Once Mogg Flunkies has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.
If an effect says that Mogg Flunkies attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Mogg Flunkies and that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

cards.originalText: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Reckless Brute
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Reckless Brute attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: His mind knows no fear, registering only the burning impulse to destroy.

rulings.text: Reckless Brute attacks only if it's able to do so as the declare attackers step begins. If, at that time, it's tapped, it's affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, you're not forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't attack in that case either.
You choose which player or planeswalker Reckless Brute attacks.

cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Reckless Brute attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Reverberate
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: "Not bad, but I can think of a better use for that."

rulings.text: Reverberate can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn't matter who controls it.

When Reverberate resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. You control the copy. That copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell Reverberate copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell Reverberate copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if a player sacrifices a 3/3 creature to cast Fling, and you copy it with Reverberate, the copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage to its target.

If the copy says that it affects "you," it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an "opponent," it affects an opponent of the copy's controller, not an opponent of the original spell's controller.

cards.originalText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Rummaging Goblin
cards.text: {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: To a goblin, value is based on the four S's: shiny, stabby, smelly, and super smelly.

rulings.text: Discarding a card is part of the cost to activate Rummaging Goblin's ability. If you don't have a card in your hand, you can't pay this part of the cost and you can't activate the ability.

cards.originalText: {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

cards.name: Searing Spear
cards.text: Searing Spear deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you die a glorious death with your sword held high. Sometimes you're just target practice.
cards.originalText: Searing Spear deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Slumbering Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Slumbering Dragon can't attack or block unless it has five or more +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, put a +1/+1 counter on Slumbering Dragon.

rulings.text: Slumbering Dragon's second ability counts all +1/+1 counters on it, not just the ones added by its third ability.
The +1/+1 counter is put on Slumbering Dragon before blockers are declared. This may allow Slumbering Dragon to "wake up" and block the creature that attacked and caused its ability to trigger.
Slumbering Dragon's third ability will trigger once for each creature that attacks you or a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Slumbering Dragon can't attack or block unless it has five or more +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, put a +1/+1 counter on Slumbering Dragon.

cards.name: Smelt
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Looks like that wasn't darksteel after all."
—Koth of the Hammer
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Thundermaw Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Thundermaw Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each creature with flying your opponents control. Tap those creatures.

rulings.text: Thundermaw Hellkite will deal 1 damage to each creature with flying your opponents control whether those creatures are tapped or untapped.

If the damage that would be dealt to a creature with flying is prevented, that creature will still be tapped. If that damage is redirected to another creature, the creature with flying will be tapped, not necessarily the creature that ultimately was dealt damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Thundermaw Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each creature with flying your opponents control. Tap those creatures.

cards.name: Torch Fiend
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Turn to Slag
cards.text: Turn to Slag deals 5 damage to target creature. Destroy all Equipment attached to that creature.
cards.flavor:
"If it wasn't a blackened, stinking, melted abomination before, it certainly is now."
—Koth of the Hammer

rulings.text: You may target any creature, not just one with Equipment attached to it. The targeted creature will still be dealt damage even if no Equipment is attached to it.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Turn to Slag resolves, the spell doesn't resolve. No Equipment is destroyed.

cards.originalText: Turn to Slag deals 5 damage to target creature. Destroy all Equipment attached to that creature.

cards.name: Volcanic Geyser
cards.text: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "The mountain's fire surges beneath your feet, demanding release. Can you not feel it?"
cards.originalText: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Volcanic Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: The mountains bend to no one.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has mountainwalk. (It's unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mercy is for those who keep their distance.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wild Guess
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: No guts, no glory.

rulings.text: Because discarding a card is an additional cost, you can't cast Wild Guess if you have no other cards in hand.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Wild Guess, discard a card.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Worldfire
cards.text: Exile all permanents. Exile all cards from all hands and graveyards. Each player's life total becomes 1.
cards.flavor: Even the smallest spark may set a world ablaze.

rulings.text: These actions are performed in order, but no triggered abilities resolve in between them and no player may cast spells or activate abilities in between them. This means that if a permanent's ability triggers on a player losing life, that permanent will be exiled first and won't be on the battlefield when your life total becomes 1. Leaves-the-battlefield triggers won't resolve until you're done resolving Worldfire entirely.
If your life total is greater than 1 when Worldfire resolves, the change in life total will count as life loss. Other effects that interact with life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.
Worldfire won't be exiled. It will go to your graveyard as the final part of its resolution.

cards.originalText: Exile all permanents. Exile all cards from all hands and graveyards. Each player's life total becomes 1.

cards.name: Acidic Slime
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.originalText:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Arbor Elf
cards.text: {T}: Untap target Forest.
cards.flavor: "The forest will surround you with its life if you are still and calm."
cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target Forest.

cards.name: Bond Beetle
cards.text: When Bond Beetle enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
A beetle on your shoulder
—Elvish expression meaning
"a blessing of luck"

rulings.text: You can choose Bond Beetle as the target of its own ability.

cards.originalText: When Bond Beetle enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Boundless Realms
cards.text: Search your library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the number of lands you control, and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Planeswalking cannot be taught. Either you see the doors or you do not."
—Nissa Revane

rulings.text: The number of basic land cards you put onto the battlefield is equal to the number of lands you control when Boundless Realms begins resolving.

cards.originalText: Search your library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the number of lands you control, and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Bountiful Harvest
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.
cards.flavor:
"When we fail to see the beauty in every tree, we are no better than humans."
—Saelia, elvish scout
cards.originalText: You gain 1 life for each land you control.

cards.name: Centaur Courser
cards.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

foreignNames.name: ケンタウルスの狩猟者

cards.name: Deadly Recluse
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Even dragons fear its silken strands.
cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Duskdale Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.originalText: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Elderscale Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Elderscale Wurm enters the battlefield, if your life total is less than 7, your life total becomes 7.
As long as you have 7 or more life, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 7 reduces it to 7 instead.

rulings.text: Elderscale Wurm's last ability doesn't prevent damage. It only changes the result of damage dealt to you. For example, a creature will lifelink that deals damage to you will still cause its controller to gain life, even if that damage would reduce your life total to less than 7.
Elderscale Wurm's last ability doesn't affect the loss or payment of life.
If you have less than 7 life, damage dealt to you reduces your life total as normal.

If damage is dealt to you and Elderscale Wurm at the same time, and that damage is enough to destroy Elderscale Wurm and reduce your life total to 7 or less, Elderscale Wurm's ability will still apply. For example, if you have 10 life and a spell deals 10 damage to you and 10 damage to Elderscale Wurm, you'll end up at 7 life and Elderscale Wurm will be destroyed.
In a Commander game, combat damage you're dealt by a commander is still tracked, even if it doesn't change your life total.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Elderscale Wurm enters the battlefield, if your life total is less than 7, your life total becomes 7.
As long as you have 7 or more life, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 7 reduces it to 7 instead.

cards.name: Elvish Archdruid
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} for each Elf you control.
cards.flavor: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.

rulings.text: Elvish Archdruid's first ability affects only other Elves you control. However, Elvish Archdruid's second ability counts all Elves you control — including itself.
Elvish Archdruid's activated ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and players can't respond to it.

cards.originalText:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf you control.

cards.name: Elvish Visionary
cards.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."
cards.originalText: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Farseek
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."

rulings.text: The card can have other land types, including Forest, as long as it also has one of the listed land types.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Flinthoof Boar
cards.text:
Flinthoof Boar gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
{R}: Flinthoof Boar gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: Through the smoke and flames it hunts, sniffing out the panicked and confused.
cards.originalText:
Flinthoof Boar gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
{R}: Flinthoof Boar gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."
—Lord Hilneth
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Fungal Sprouting
cards.text: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"Saprolings need only a host to feed upon. Numbers will take care of the rest."
—Ghave, Guru of Spores

rulings.text: Fungal Sprouting doesn't target any creature. The greatest power among creatures you control is determined when Fungal Sprouting resolves.

cards.originalText: Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

cards.name: Garruk, Primal Hunter
cards.text:
+1: Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
−3: Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
−6: Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token for each land you control.

rulings.text: For Garruk's second ability, the greatest power among creatures you control is determined when that ability begins resolving.
If the greatest power among creatures you control is 0 or less, you'll draw no cards. You won't discard any cards this way.
For Garruk's third ability, the number of Wurm tokens you put onto the battlefield is determined when that ability begins resolving.

cards.originalText:
+1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
-3: Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
-6: Put a 6/6 green Wurm creature token onto the battlefield for each land you control.

cards.name: Garruk's Packleader
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 3 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"He has learned much in his long years. And unlike selfish humans, he's willing to share."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

rulings.text: If Garruk's Packleader and another creature with power 3 or greater enter the battlefield under your control at the same time, the ability will trigger.

The ability checks the power of each creature as it enters the battlefield. It will take into account counters the permanent enters the battlefield with and static abilities that affect its power (such as Flinthoof Boar's ability). After the creature is on the battlefield, raising its power with a spell (such as Titanic Growth), an activated ability, or a triggered ability won't cause this ability to retroactively trigger.
The creature's power is checked only to see if the ability triggers. It doesn't matter what the creature's power is when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature with power 3 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Ground Seal
cards.text:
When Ground Seal enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Cards in graveyards can't be the targets of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor:
"Let all we have buried be buried forever."
—Seton, centaur druid

rulings.text: The last ability only works when Ground Seal is on the battlefield.
Only spells and abilities that target cards in graveyards will be affected. Abilities that don't target cards in graveyards (like the one Tormod's Crypt has) can still affect those cards.

cards.originalText:
When Ground Seal enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Cards in graveyards can't be the targets of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Mwonvuli Beast Tracker
cards.text: When Mwonvuli Beast Tracker enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with deathtouch, hexproof, reach, or trample and reveal it. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
cards.flavor: "The more dangerous, the better."

rulings.text: The creature card must have one of the listed abilities, not an ability that grants one of the listed abilities to the creature. For example, you couldn't put Prized Elephant, which has "{G}: Prized Elephant gains trample until end of turn," on top of your library this way.

foreignNames.name: Traqueuse de bête de la Mwônvouli
ムウォンヴーリーの獣記し

cards.originalText: When Mwonvuli Beast Tracker enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with deathtouch, hexproof, reach, or trample and reveal it. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.
